channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Bags household refuse dumped, 2nd February
item.description:
Opposite Afro Foods. Please remove? Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Linsey Street, Bermondsey, Greater London

item.title: Building site regular causing huge mess on pavement, 2nd February
item.description:
There is a building site on West Street Erith near number 80. It is daily making such a huge mess on the footpaths making it unwalkable without ruining footwear. It is absolutely appalling and is making people walk in the road. The builders have been asked but are very rude. This has to be a breach of a duty of care by the builders. Please get this resolved.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): West Street, Northumberland Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned car, 2nd February

item.title: Car parked overlapping dropped kerb blocking 2 driveways, 2nd February
item.description:
This car has parked overlapping 2 dropped kerbs (Lawrie Park Gardens, SE26 6HW) preventing access where there are legally parked cars the other side. It is also overlapping the dropped kerb of a house, and preventing garage access for the business who use the garage the other side. License plate - FE56 SZW.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, Lawrie Park Gardens, Forest Hill, Greater London

item.title: Untaxed rubbish lorry parking dangerously, 2nd February
item.description:
This lorry puts false parking tickets on its windscreen so that wardens ignore it. It was piled high with waste a couple of weeks ago - about 6 feet above the sides of the lorry with plasterboard holding the rubbish in place, but precariously. It was parked on double yellow lines at the entrance to Dene Avenue causing a hazard - no sightline to the road on entry.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dene Avenue, Blendon, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Persistent dog fouling on pavement, 2nd February
item.description:
There is often dog poo on the pavement around here. Most often near the postbox. There are young children around. Once we accidentally trod it into the nearby hospital.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Heathwood Gardens, Charlton
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bexley borough flag on flag pole east wickham open space, 2nd February
item.description:
The Bexley Borough flag is in tatters and needs to be replaced or removed also remove the Egland flag that is in tatters also. Suggest replace with the Union flag and so some pride

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Yew Tree Close, East Wickham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
